column3:
That would require a hard fork.

P2SH redeemscripts are limited to 520 bytes, because that is how much can be pushed by the standard push operations. For multisig, that means maximum 15 (compressed) public keys - more just don't fit.

I would be against a hard fork for this unless there is very clear utility and already widespread adoption of scripts that need up to 15.
